class_notes:
This class is for Sophomores and Juniors only.


The ECS 102 course is designed to provide an intentional framework for Emory undergraduate students to begin to clearly understand and articulate the values of a liberal arts education for both personal and professional flourishing. This course is specifically designed to help sophomores understand the foundations of a liberal arts education, the history and meaning of the liberal arts, what it means to be part of a research university, to consider the scholarship on becoming a reflective life-long learner, and to reflect more deeply on the meaning and values of work
course_description: This course provides a framework for students to articulate how to leverage a liberal arts education as they launch their post-graduation pursuits. Through assignments focused on self-assessment and exploration, students will identify and translate skills that transfer from college to career.
